malaria.title: Malaria
malaria.description: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by a parasite. It is transmitted through the bite if an infected mosquito. It is typically found in tropical and sub-tropical climates and can affects humans and other animals. In human there are 05 species that cause malaria. Malaria kills more than 445 000 people each years, many of them are children in Africa. Currently, there is no vaccine available.

hiv_aids.title: HIV/AIDS
hiv_aids.description:
The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is the virus that kills the body immune system by destroying the white blood cells that fight infection and put you at risk for serious infections or cancers.  HIV also applied to refer to the HIV infection which is a sexual transmitted infection: it can spread by contact with certain bodily fluids of a person with HIV or from a mother to the child during pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding. 
 AIDS is most advanced stage of HIV infection that occurs when the body’s immune system is badly damaged because of the virus. 
 HIV/AIDS has a large impact on society both as illness and as a source of discrimination. There is not cure but there are medicines that fight HIV/AIDS and lower the risk of infecting other

hepatitis.title: Hepatitis
hepatitis.description: Hepatitis is a disease characterized by the inflammation of the liver, caused by virus or toxin or heavy alcohol use. There are 5 main viruses; referred to as A, B, C, D and E. A and E are caused by the ingestion of contaminated food water while B, C and D are caused by contact with a contaminated body fluids. About 1 million people die each year from causes related to Hepatitis. Some people with hepatitis have no symptoms. Some forms of the virus are mild, can be eliminated from the body and other remain for lifetime and cause serious problems like cirrhosis or cancer.
